t: Job 18
Bildad: The Wicked Are Punished
Then*p Bildad the Shuhite answered and said:
“How*pn long till*i you put an end to words? Gain*ld understanding, and afterward we will speak.
Why*ld are we counted as beasts, And*ild regarded as stupid in your sight?
You*ld who tear yourself in anger, Shall*ld the earth be forsaken for you? Or*ld shall the rock be removed from its place?
“The*ln light of the wicked indeed goes out, And*ld the flame of his fire does not shine.
The*ld light is dark in his tent, And*ld his lamp beside him is put out.
The*ld steps of his strength are shortened, And*ld his own counsel casts him down.
For*ld he is cast into a net by his own feet, And*ld he walks into a snare.
The*ld net takes him*i by the heel, And*ild a snare lays hold of him.
A*ld noose is*i hidden for him on the ground, And*ld a trap for him in the road.
Terrors*ld frighten him on every side, And*ld drive him to his feet.
His*ld strength is starved, And*ld destruction is*i ready at his side.
It*ld devours patches of his skin; The*ld firstborn of death devours his limbs.
He*ld is uprooted from the shelter of his tent, And*ld they parade him before the king of terrors.
They*ld dwell in his tent who*i are*i none of his; Brimstone*ld is scattered on his dwelling.
His*ld roots are dried out below, And*ld his branch withers above.
The*ld memory of him perishes from the earth, And*ld he has no name among the renowned.
He*ld is driven from light into darkness, And*ld chased out of the world.
He*ld has neither son nor posterity among his people, Nor*ld any remaining in his dwellings.
Those*ld in the west are astonished at his day, As*ld those in the east are frightened.
Surely*ld such are*i the dwellings of the wicked, And*ld this is*i the place of*i him*i who*i does not know God.”
